alert.note: Alert for Dauphin; Lancaster; Lebanon; Northumberland; Schuylkill; Snyder; Union (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued March 28 at 12:13PM EDT until March 28 at 1:30PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: The National Weather Service in State College PA has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Dauphin County in south central Pennsylvania... Northern Lancaster County in south central Pennsylvania... Lebanon County in south central Pennsylvania... Southern Northumberland County in central Pennsylvania... Schuylkill County in central Pennsylvania... Snyder County in central Pennsylvania... Southern Union County in central Pennsylvania... * Until 130 PM EDT. * At 1212 PM EDT, Several bands of dangerous snow squalls with the most notable on located along a line extending from Laurelton Center to Kreamer to Beurys Lake to McKeansburg, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Extremely poor visibility in snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect hazardous road conditions. This includes the following Interstates... The Pennsylvania Turnpike from mile markers 247 to 295. Interstate 78 from mile markers 0 to 8. Interstate 81 from mile markers 65 to 120. Interstate 83 from mile markers 43 to 50. Interstate 283 from mile markers 0 to 2. Locations impacted include... Harrisburg, Lebanon, Pottsville, Hershey, Ephrata, Elizabethtown, Sunbury, Lititz, Middletown, Shamokin, Palmyra and Linglestown. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. Wet roadways will quickly freeze. Black ice will cause roads, bridges and overpasses to become slick and dangerous. Slow down and be prepared for sudden loss of traction.

area.areaDesc: Dauphin; Lancaster; Lebanon; Northumberland; Schuylkill; Snyder; Union
